context.note: If you are not installing Eucalyptus HA, skip this section.
context.p: Walrus uses DRBD for disk replication. In Eucalyptus HA, Eucalyptus replicates storage from the primary Walrus server to the secondary Walrus server. For more information about DRBD, go to What is DRBD.

We recommend that you choose a disk for each Walrus that is large enough to hold all objects and buckets you ever expect to have, including all images that will ever be registered to your system, plus any Amazon S3 application data. For consistent performance, we recommend that you use identical disks for the primary and secondary Walrus.
context.note: We recommend that you use LVM (Logical Volume Manager). Should you run out of disk space, LVM allows you to add disks and migrate the data.
context.p: Before you begin, ensure that you have the following information:

ul.li: The IP address and hostname of each Walrus
The DRBD block device name of each Walrus. In the following examples, we assume that DRBD block device name is /dev/drbd1.
The DRBD backing disk partition names on each Walrus. A partition (either on a new disk or an existing disk) should be dedicated to Walrus. The partition sizes should be identical.

context.p: Configuring DRBD requires that you complete edit the Eucalyptus DRBD file to include your Walrus information, and edit the master DRBD file to tell it to look for the Eucalyptus DRBD file.

step.cmd: Copy the example Eucalyptus DRBD file (/etc/eucalyptus/drbd.conf.template) to /etc/eucalyptus/drbd.conf.
Open the /etc/eucalyptus/drbd.conf file and make the following edits:

ul.li: Change the value of <walrus-host-1> to the hostname of the primary Walrus.
Change the value of <drbd-block-dev, e.g., /dev/drbd1> to /dev/drbd1
Change the value of <drbd-backing-disk-dev, e.g. /dev/sdb1> to /dev/sdb1
Change the value of <walrus-host-1-ip> to the IP address of the primary Walrus.
Change the value of <walrus-host-2> to the hostname of the secondary Walrus.
Change the value of <drbd-block-dev, e.g., /dev/drbd1> to /dev/drbd1
Change the value of <drbd-backing-disk-dev, e.g. /dev/sdb1> to /dev/sdb1
Change the value of <walrus-host-2-ip> to the IP address of the secondary Walrus.
